intro: Myosotis albicans, commonly known as the white forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its small, delicate blue or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Myosotis albicans is a perennial herb that is cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
